messages.messageBody:
That's such a great idea to start something like that. We haven't
got lots of room but come on over to Santa monica. Stay here. We're
getting a new sleeper sofa this month.
Alison and Asher

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Traveling/Unschooling Ideas
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: sherylshomler@yahoo.com I thought it would be prime opportunity and much cheaper to travel in a few months to visit him with a dual purpose. Check
messages.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: sherylshomler@...

I thought it would be prime opportunity and much cheaper to travel in a
few months to visit him with a dual purpose. Check out our country, our
capital's sites and just in general learn more cheap. Road trips can be
quite expensive. Is there a homeschooling group that does home hosting
while you check out the USA? If not, would it not be fun to start one?

Just a thought. If anyone has ideas on nearly free travel and such..I'm
all ears and willing to listen and see if it would work for our family.

-=-=-=-=-

Off-hand, I don't know of a group. But you're welcome to stay here a
couple of days.

Columbia, SC

We have a lot going on (as usual); but if we're in town, you're welcome
to crash here. Capitol city. Nice zoo and museums. Pool. I cook. <g>

It's not as if we're on the way or anything, but if you'd like to
travel around and see more of the country, we're available.


Just let us know.



~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://www.LiveandLearnConference.org


________________________________________________________________________
AOL now offers free email to everyone. Find out more about what's free
from AOL at AOL.com.

messages.subject: Traveling/Unschooling Ideas
messages.msgSnippet: My 20ds is being transfered for only 6 months from his Seattle based job to Washington DC. They are setting him up with an apartment and everything. I thought
messages.messageBody:
My 20ds is being transfered for only 6 months from his Seattle based
job to Washington DC. They are setting him up with an apartment and
everything.

I thought it would be prime opportunity and much cheaper to travel in a
few months to visit him with a dual purpose. Check out our country, our
capital's sites and just in general learn more cheap. Road trips can be
quite expensive. Is there a homeschooling group that does home hosting
while you check out the USA? If not, would it not be fun to start one?

Just a thought. If anyone has ideas on nearly free travel and such..I'm
all ears and willing to listen and see if it would work for our family.

Thanks in advance.

Sheryl
